question: In segmentation, each address is specified by ____________
options: ['a) a segment number & offset', 'b) an offset & value', 'c) a value & segment number', 'd) a key & value']

question: In paging the user provides only ________ which is partitioned by the hardware into ________ and ______
options: ['a) one address, page number, offset', 'b) one offset, page number, address', 'c) page number, offset, address', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) one address, page number, offset
option2: b) one offset, page number, address

question: Each entry in a segment table has a ____________
options: ['a) segment base', 'b) segment peak', 'c) segment value', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: The segment base contains the ____________
options: ['a) starting logical address of the process', 'b) starting physical address of the segment in memory', 'c) segment length', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) starting logical address of the process
option2: b) starting physical address of the segment in memory

question: The segment limit contains the ____________
options: ['a) starting logical address of the process', 'b) starting physical address of the segment in memory', 'c) segment length', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) starting logical address of the process
option2: b) starting physical address of the segment in memory

question: The offset ‘d’ of the logical address must be ____________
options: ['a) greater than segment limit', 'b) between 0 and segment limit', 'c) between 0 and the segment number', 'd) greater than the segment number']
option3: c) between 0 and the segment number
option4: d) greater than the segment number

question: If the offset is legal ____________
options: ['a) it is used as a physical memory address itself', 'b) it is subtracted from the segment base to produce the physical memory address', 'c) it is added to the segment base to produce the physical memory address', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) it is used as a physical memory address itself
option2: b) it is subtracted from the segment base to produce the physical memory address
option3: c) it is added to the segment base to produce the physical memory address

question: When the entries in the segment tables of two different processes point to the same physical location ____________
options: ['a) the segments are invalid', 'b) the processes get blocked', 'c) segments are shared', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: The protection bit is 0/1 based on ____________
options: ['a) write only', 'b) read only', 'c) read – write', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: If there are 32 segments, each of size 1Kb, then the logical address should have ____________
explanation: To specify a particular segment, 5 bits are required. To select a particular byte after selecting a page, 10 more bits are required. Hence 15 bits are required.

question: Consider a computer with 8 Mbytes of main memory and a 128K cache
A multilevel page table is preferred in comparison to a single level page table for translating virtual address to physical address because ____________
options: ['a) it reduces the memory access time to read or write a memory location', 'b) it helps to reduce the size of page table needed to implement the virtual address space of a process', 'c) it is required by the translation lookaside buffer', 'd) it helps to reduce the number of page faults in page replacement algorithms']
option1: a) it reduces the memory access time to read or write a memory location
option2: b) it helps to reduce the size of page table needed to implement the virtual address space of a process
option3: c) it is required by the translation lookaside buffer
option4: d) it helps to reduce the number of page faults in page replacement algorithms
